comments:
Build ID: I20070209-1006

When node is removed it calls it's parent method to remove itself. Then parent fires notification that node was removed.
In org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.legacy.PreferenceForwarder.java#removed(org.eclipse.core.runtime.preferences.IEclipsePreferences.NodeChangeEvent)
methods tries to remove this object form node's listeners set. Because node was marked as removed, exception is thrown.

Stack trace:

Created an attachment (id=61690)
simple patch proposal

Actually when looking at the code further, we should just get rid of the code in the #removed callback because there is nothing we can do at this point since the node has already been removed. I have released this change and a corresponding test case to HEAD.
